game

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    The Board class represents the tic-tac-toe board for a game.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    AlexKerzner

        Get the column of a location value.
        Parameters:
        location - the location (1 through 9: 1 being bottom left, 4 being middle left, 9 being top right, etc.) of a square
        Returns:
        the row (1 being the top row, and 3 being the bottom) the square is in

        Parameters:
        row - the row (1 being the top row, and 3 being the bottom) the square is in
        column - the column (1 being the left column, 3 being the right column) the square is in
        Returns:
        true, if either row or column is not 1, 2, or 3.

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        See Also:
        isGameOver(boolean force_check)

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver(boolean force_check)

        Normal usage

        Returns the value of game_over.
        If the optional parameter force_check is present and is true, checks for a winner to the game. If the game is over, changes game_over to true.

        Checking for a winner

        Checks only the row, column, and diagonal (if along a diagonal) sets on the board. Only checks either two, three, or four sets of three values.
        Only checks for a winner if move_count is between 5 and 9.
        Sets game_winner to Square.X or Square.O indicating the winner of the game, or Square.EMPTY if a cats (tie) game or the game is not over
        Parameters:
        force_check - a boolean value indicating whether or not to force a check for game-over
        Returns:
        true, if the game is over according to game_over

      • isUndoPossible

        public boolean isUndoPossible()
        Return true if undo is possible
        Returns:
        true, if undo is possible
        See Also:
        Board

      • undo

        public int undo()
        Undo a move, if possible.
        Returns:
        the location of the move undone, or -1 if not undone.
        See Also:
        Board

      • getLastPlayer

        public Square getLastPlayer()
        Returns the winner of the game, if the game is over. If the game is not over, returns the last player to move.
        Returns:
        a Square
        See Also:
        Board

      • next

        public boolean next(int location,
           Square square)
             throws GameOverException,
                    SquareNotEmpty,
                    SquareOutOfBounds
        Makes the next move. Checks if the game is over. Returns true if the move ended the game.
        Parameters:
        location - the location (1 through 9: 1 being bottom left, 4 being middle left, 9 being top right, etc.) of a square
        square - a Square
        Returns:
        true, if game is over
        Throws:
        GameOverException - the game is over, and can no longer be modified
        SquareNotEmpty - the square at location is not empty
        SquareOutOfBounds - there is no square at location
        See Also:
        Board
